question: Who wrote the song 'You're My Best Friend'?
oriSent: The song 'You're My Best Friend' was written by John Deacon, the former bass guitarist of Queen.

question: When was the song 'You're My Best Friend' penned?
oriSent: It was penned in 1975, the same year that Deacon married his wife, Veronica Tetzlaff.

question: Who is the song 'You're My Best Friend' dedicated to?
oriSent: The song is dedicated to her and expresses his deep love and admiration for her.

question: How does Deacon define his wife in the song?
phrase: personification of all the world has to offer to him
oriSent: He defines her as being the personification of all the world has to offer to him.

question: Why does Deacon have to come back to his wife?
phrase: not only for the joy he experiences in her company but also because she is the one who has stood with him through thick and thin
oriSent: Even when he wanders astray, he has to come back to her, not only for the joy he experiences in her company but also because she is the one who has stood with him through thick and thin.

question: What does Deacon ultimately conclude about his wife?
phrase: she is his 'best friend' and has become an invaluable part of his earthly existence
oriSent: All of this ultimately boils down to him coming to the conclusion that she is his “best friend” and in fact has become an invaluable part of his earthly existence.
